page.title: 09Newton Village 1980's
page.content: Newton,lying on the north-east side of Rugby,has a population of 312 and is bordered to the north by the M6 and to the east by the A5.One main road passes through the village.Houses comprise a mixture of old,new,private and council.The combined post office and shop satisfies basic needs and there is also a restaurant called Tabuteau,plus 2 pubs-The Stag & Pheasant and St. Thomas's Cross.Though surrounded by farm land,few actually work on the land but there is little unemployment.20 years ago,excavations from Newton to beyond A5 were carried out for sand and gravel but the land has now been reclaimed.A water filled pit,Clifton Pool is now used for fishing.A mobile library visits every fortnight.There are allotments also.
